docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, May 4 -Western Hemisphere economists have asserted that plans for Latin-American economic integration have now reached a decisive, perhaps critical, point.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, May 4 -Western Hemisphere economists have asserted that plans for Latin-American economic integration have now reached a decisive, perhaps critical, point.
docs.abstract: Inter-Amer Com for the Alliance for Progress rept, stressing need for decisive action on econ integration, urges formation of Latin-Amer common mkt between '70 and '85; proposes tariff preferences in trade with US amd creation of inter-Amer fund to help stabilize commodity prices; cites recent internatl trade and monetary developments that have hurt progress

headline.main: Board Warns Latins on Economic Lag

docs.snippet: The May cotton futures contract went off the board yesterday with a show of weakness. It expired at 29.22 cents a pound, down from 29.83. This was closer to the lifetime low of 26.05 than to the high o 40.35.
docs.lead_paragraph: The May cotton futures contract went off the board yesterday with a show of weakness. It expired at 29.22 cents a pound, down from 29.83. This was closer to the lifetime low of 26.05 than to the high o 40.35.

headline.main: Commodities: May Cotton Shows Weakness and Closes at 29.22 Cents Per Pound; SOME FARMERS ARE DISCOURAGED

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 10 -- A middle-aged woman in a well - tailored wool suit walked into the crowded United States Consulate here to ask about the requirements for immigrating into the United States.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 10 -- A middle-aged woman in a well - tailored wool suit walked into the crowded United States Consulate here to ask about the requirements for immigrating into the United States.
docs.abstract: Substantial emigration rate attributed to inflation, pol instability and decline from prosperous to poor nation

headline.main: Uruguayan Emigration Rises Fourfold in Growing Inflation

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, May 16 -The United States has halted all development aid loans to Peru for the current fiscal year.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, May 16 -The United States has halted all development aid loans to Peru for the current fiscal year.
docs.abstract: US halts $37-million in development aid, fiscal '68, because of Peru purchase of French supersonic jet airplanes costing over $20-million; acts under '68 foreign aid bill amendment mandating cuts equal to amt recipient nations spend on arms; Repr Long, amendment co-sponsor, says resumption next yr depends on size of Peru defense budget; notes tech and food aid continues

headline.main: U.S. ENDS PERU AID IN CENSURE MOVE; Acts After Lima Purchases Costly French Jets U.S. ENDS PERU AID IN CENSURE MOVE

byline.original: By BENJAMIN WELLESSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, May 18 (UPI) -- Soccer football players who misbehave in Buenos Aires run not only the risk of being sent to the showers, but also can land in jail as well. It's already happened several times this year.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, May 18 (UPI) -- Soccer football players who misbehave in Buenos Aires run not only the risk of being sent to the showers, but also can land in jail as well. It's already happened several times this year.

headline.main: Buenos Aires Police Revive Edict to Curb Soccer Players

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, May 18 -- Galo Plaza Lasso, a former President of Ecuador and United Nations mediator, was installed at the Pan American Union here today as Secretary General of the 23nation Organization of American States.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, May 18 -- Galo Plaza Lasso, a former President of Ecuador and United Nations mediator, was installed at the Pan American Union here today as Secretary General of the 23nation Organization of American States.

headline.main: PLAZA INSTALLED AS HEAD OF O.A.S.; Pledges Steps to Revitalize the Alliance for Progress

docs.snippet: SANTA CRUZ, Bolivia, May 21 -- Five South American nations have agreed to work cooperatively in the economic development of a vast area drained by the Rio de la Plata.
docs.lead_paragraph: SANTA CRUZ, Bolivia, May 21 -- Five South American nations have agreed to work cooperatively in the economic development of a vast area drained by the Rio de la Plata.
docs.abstract: 5 S Amer nations (Argentina, Brazil, Bolivia, Paraguay and Uruguay) agree to work cooperatively in econ development of vast area drained by river; foreign mins conclude 2 days of talks with document committing them to future cooperation and plans for specific projects; some projects noted; 1st priority is given to hydrographic and meteorological study of basin; descending priority assigned to analysis of natural resources in area, improving navigation and bldg roads and rrs; other details

headline.main: LATIN STATES SIGN PLATA BASIN PACT; 5 Nations Plan Long-Term Development of Region LATIN STATES SIGN PLATA BASIN PACT
